result.execSummary:
The defendant Orville O Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orville O Baker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orville O Baker was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Orville O Baker was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber the first three months for treatment purposes only.  The last three months will be huber for employment, treatment or whatever the huber rules of Rusk County allow.
Concurrent with: Count 2

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge

DE will serve 6 months jail time with huber.  

2022GF100 was consolidated into 2022CF124

The first three months huber release will be for treatment purposes only.  The last three months DE will have huber for employment, treatment or whatever the Rusk County huber privilege allows.
Concurrent with: Count one

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orville O Baker

records.addlTxt: DNA

10:51 AM Defendant Orville O Baker in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Orville O Baker.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 2020CF88, 22CF124.  Atty Erdman states agreement for the court.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 1 in 20CF88 and Ct's 1, 2 in 22CF124. All sides free to argue.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty. DE will waive his right to a PSI.

Sentencing argument entered by the State.  State will be asking for time served in 20CF88, DE has credit for 122 days.  20CF124-State asking for jail time with huber for treatment purposes only.

Defense asks for time served, offers the court some history on DE.  DE has indicated he will seek treatment through Pathways per Atty Erdman.  Mr Baker addresses the court. DE states he has learned his lesson, wants to get back to his children and life, does not want probation for these matters, does not have a good history with probation.  

The court will order in 20CF88 Time served, CC/DNA/Surcharge. 

22CF124-6 months jail.  DE will have huber privilege, the first three months will be huber for treatment only. The last three months will be for treatment, employment or whatever  Rusk County huber privilege allows.
Review hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Orville O Baker appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Orville O Baker.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 2020CF88, 2022CF124. Atty Erdman informs an offer was presented and a counter offer was made.  22CF124-waive reading of the information, enter a plea of NG.
Arraignment on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
NOH for 22CF124 and 20CF88 emailed to the jail.
Arraignment on September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

2:38 PM Defendant Orville O Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court. Court will reschedule this appearance, the court was unable to reach Atty Erdman.
Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Arraignment on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:02 AM Defendant Orville O Baker in court from RC Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Orville O Baker.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 20CF88, 20CF124.  DE will waive PH in 22CF124. Court instructs on waiver of PH, waiver made knowingly, freely and voluntarily, court will accept waiver of PH.  Atty has filed a Motion for bond modification.  DE does live locally, is a care taker for a friend, asking for a sign bond.  State argues bond, no changes in circumstances for bond modification, DE has failed to appear for court in the past.  DE would like just a couple days to be out and get his affairs in order, collect his possessions and secure his belongings. The court will deny the motion for bond modification at this time.  Set for Arraignment/RH 9/12/22 @ 2:30pm.  ZOOM. DE will waive his right to personal appearance. Adj 10:12am.
Certified bond from Rusk County Case 20CF88
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:10 PM Defendant Orville O Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Orville O Baker. Heard along with 22CF88, 22CF124.  22CF124-Adj Init App-Waive reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for PH.  Set for PH/RH August 30, 2022 @ 10:00am. Adj 1:15pm

1:10 PM Defendant Orville O Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Orville O Baker. Heard along with 22CF88, 22CF124.  22CF124-Adj Init App-Waive reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for PH.  Set for PH/RH August 30, 2022 @ 10:00am. Adj 1:15pm

:9:45 AM Defendant Orville O Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Orville O Baker. Atty would like to address bond, DE has been incarcerated for some time, wishes to be on a Sign bond so he can secure his belongings and his residence.  The State opposes any reduction in bond, DE has failed to come to court many times. The court will order cash bond remain, motion denied. Adj 9:25
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Annette M Barna in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orville O Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court.  Attorney Osberg appeared at this hearing only but did not have ability to comment on case without knowing history of cases.   Both cases 22CF124 and 20CF88 heard.   Court reviewed DE appearances in the past.  DE requested a signature bond.   State argued for a cash bond.   Court ordered cash bonds in these matters.   Cash will be as stated on the warrants.   Set matters for what is needed.   JA to schedule.    Adj. 1:51 PM.
Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)
